column4: Hi all.  My external hdd worked fine until today, but now when I plug it in, nothing happens.  I can see it through GPartEd, but with a warning icon (exclamation point in yellow triangle) next to it.  Right-click>Properties, and the warning is: "Unable to read the contents of this file system! Because of this some operations may be unavailable."  Can anyone help me with the goal of recovering the data on this drive?
what format is the drive in?
I'm running Ubuntu 9.04, which ships with ntfs3g, and it has never had a problem reading this drive before.
it's possible that it was unmounted improperly once or twice.
if its been unmounted improperly it will usually lock the file system so you can't damage it further
It can see the drive, but can't mount it.
sounds like the drive may be toast
Mac OSX is based on Darwin which is a BSD fork
you can try the freezer trick
just plugged in the drive again to my Ubuntu box and it mounted it.. hmm.
but sometimes Nautilus gives me an error when I try to list a directory.
sounds like the drive is dying, UBCD has some tools to test drives
well since it's mounting now, I'd like to try to backup as much data as it will let me immediately?  Is there a better app for me to use than dd at the cli?
dd will copy everything including empty blocks, might be better off using clonezilla or just copying things with nautilu
Ah, thanks.  Will clonezilla know how to deal with bad blocks (retry them, skip them?) or will the first one cause the whole backup to fail?
not sure,  I havent used it
